answers.answer: This may not be what you want to hear, but maturation is probably going to take care of your thinness.  You just have to be patient.  It actually was the norm for American teenagers to be thin until about 1980, when our eating habits started changing for the worse.  People of all ages got heavier when we started to eat a lot of junk food and drink a lot of soda pop -- but I don't recommend that, because it's not healthy.Eat healthy food, and eat all you want.  Have fun with your exercise.  Love yourself as you are. Eat all you want of healthy foods like whole-grain breads, fruits, vegetables, dairy products, meats, fish, and nuts and seeds.  Other than that, I don't know of any good way to gain weight.  You may simply not be able to gain much weight at age 14, and that's normal.  Leave the junk food and sugar alone.  They're not good for you, and you can form bad habits with those unhealthy foods that will stick with you for many years, even after you have gained all the weight you want to.You can eat full-fat dairy products, because you can use the calories.  You don't need to drink reduced fat milk or skim milk, and you don't need to eat reduced fat cheese.  If you enjoy eating nuts and seeds (like sunflower seeds and pumpkin seeds), you can eat all you want of those.  If you do like nuts and seeds, you can eat handfuls of them raw or dry-roasted, but I would stay away from the ones cooked in oil, because the oil that is used for that is not usually the healthiest.For the age that you are, your body is doing what nature intended.  Please don't judge your appearance by comparing yourself to mature women or even to the girls your own age who live on junk food and soda pop.  Many of your peers are, in truth, overweight.  Don't be jealous of them.  Instead, be happy.The right clothes look fantastic on slender girls.  Just get good at picking out the styles that flatter you.  You will be able to wear certain things that most girls can't wear and wish they could.  Try on lots of clothes in the mirror, see what you think looks good on your, and also get feedback from others about what you look good in.  When you get a compliment on your clothes, figure out what it was about that piece that makes you look good, and focus on adding more of that style to your wardrobe.The real issue is not to gain weight, but to be happy in your life.  Right?  Okay, you can do it.

Have you been tested for hyperthyroidism?  Do you have other symptoms that might indicate hyperthyroidism, other than weight issues?What about diabetes?  A major symptom of juvenile diabetes is weight loss or inability to gain.

Barb135, your point is well taken that medical issues should be ruled out.  I was not thinking of skinny_truth's situation in that way, obviously, but my 17 year-old neice just was diagnosed with Type I diabetes, so I should have been.  Kids can be thin without being ill, but a physical exam to make sure would be a good thing.

question: Hi I'm a 14 year old  5'6, 106 lbs teen girl. My metabolism is sky high and no matter what, I CANNOT gain weight. I don't want to be huge, just so I can fit clothes a little better. Also I'm interested in fitness and excercise like weight-lifting, running, etc. Can anyone help me?
title: Help gaining weight?
